   WBC 1.5 with 7 days of fevers and chills despite broad coverage
   antimicrobial therapy. With likely brain abscesses, pneumonia, and
   thigh abscess.
   1. Fevers:

   neutropenic and continues to have a low absolute neutrophil count and
   underlying APML concerning for an immunocompromised immune system. He
   has been on broad spectrum antibiotics as well as fungal and viral
   coverage. What infectious organisms may be present remains unclear. A
   single blood culture showed Strep viridans, which could be a
   contamanent. Otherwise BCx have been negative though this is not
   unexpected given his broad spectrum coverage. CSF and urine have been
   negative. TEE has been negative. Thigh abscess shows staph. Head CT is
   suggestive for mycotic aneurysms. Chest CT shows multiple foci of
   consolidation concerning for pneumonia. He may therefore have multiple
   simultaneous infections, or he may have a seed of infection with
   hematologic spread to brain and lung. An alternative possibility for
   his fevers includes retinoic acid syndrome give ATRA treatment, however
   it would be unusual timing and should only be considered if infectious
   etiology is ruled out.

   His hct has been decreasing and has had limited increase with
   transfusions. There is no clinical indication of bleeding, he is guiac

   compromised due to his anemia. He may have low level hemolysis though
